sleep_index.title: Your Sleep Index trend over the last 3 weeks
sleep_index.description: The sleep index is designed to be one single metric you need to judge your sleep health, using several contributors like total sleep duration, resting HR, restfulness.

insights.description: Your overall sleep index has improved compared to the previous week. Checkout which all contributors you can improve further.

best_contributors.title: HR Drop
best_contributors.description: HR drop is defined as the time it takes for your heart rate to reach its lowest point during sleep. This marker indicates your rest and recovery quality. The earlier the drop occurs, the better your recovery and the more rested you will be.

best_contributors.title: HRV Form
best_contributors.description: This metric represents the HRV trend across the duration of your sleep.

best_contributors.title: Timing
best_contributors.description: This represents the adherence to your Circadian Rhythm.

worst_contributors.title: Total Sleep
worst_contributors.description: It represents the volume of uninterrupted sleep every night for your body.

insights.title: How to improve Total Sleep
insights.description: To improve total sleep, maintain a consistent sleep schedule and create a relaxing bedtime routine. Optimize your sleep environment by keeping it cool, dark, and quiet. Avoid screens, caffeine, and large meals before bed. Engage in regular exercise, manage stress, and limit naps to enhance sleep quality and duration.

worst_contributors.title: Sleep Efficiency
worst_contributors.description: This measures the amount of time your body spends resting and repairing while you are in bed.

insights.title: How to improve Sleep Efficiency
insights.description: You can achieve higher sleep efficiency by being in a relaxed state before bed. Improve this by following a sleep ritual, such as taking a warm shower, listening to calming music, or taking magnesium supplements.

worst_contributors.title: Restfulness
worst_contributors.description: Restfulness is measured by evaluating your movement and periods of wakefulness during sleep.

insights.title: How to improve Restfulness
insights.description: Stimulants like caffeine and nicotine can reduce restfulness, even if consumed 5-6 hours before sleep. Try limiting their intake well before your sleep window.

recovery_index.title: Your Recovery Index trend over the last 3 weeks
recovery_index.description: The Recovery Score indicates your overall state of 'well-being'. It depends on markers like resting heart rate, hrv, temperature, sleep quality, movement and recovery.

insights.description: Your overall recovery index has improved compared to the previous week. Check out which all contributors you can improve further.

best_contributors.title: Temperature
best_contributors.description: Your body temperature is an indicator of your body's state of recovery

best_contributors.title: Sleep Quotient
best_contributors.description: Sleep quality and duration are factored into this metric.

best_contributors.title: HRV Form
best_contributors.description: This metric reflects your HRV patterns and variations, which indicate your body's adaptability.

worst_contributors.title: Resting Heart Rate
worst_contributors.description: Resting Heart Rate (RHR) is an indicator of your overall cardiovascular health and fitness level. A lower RHR typically signifies better cardiovascular fitness and efficient heart function, while a higher RHR can indicate stress, overtraining, dehydration, or potential health issues.

insights.title: How to improve RHR
insights.description: Sleep quality plays a major role in improving heart efficiency. On days you arenâ€™t able to get quality sleep, try a 30 min Non-sleep deep rest protocol to improve restfulness and heart efficiency.

worst_contributors.title: Movement Index
worst_contributors.description: This represents your overall movement trends.

insights.title: How to improve Movement Index
insights.description: Establish an hourly movement routine and pair it with another core habit, such as drinking water. By linking new actions to existing habits, they become more ingrained and easier to maintain.

movement_index.title: Your Movement Index trend over the last 3 weeks
movement_index.description: The Movement Index is designed to keep you moving for optimal glucose metabolism and increase your non-exercise energy usage. It's a measure of how active you were that day.

insights.description: Your overall movement index has improved compared to the previous week. Check out which all contributors you can improve further.

best_contributors.title: Workout Frequency
best_contributors.description: This metric tracks the number of days you were highly active and the number of workouts you completed, providing a long-term measure of your overall activity.
